name: George Washington
notable_facts: Set many precedents, including serving only two terms.

name: John Adams
previous_position: Vice President of the United States
notable_facts: First president to reside in the White House.

name: Thomas Jefferson
previous_position: Vice President of the United States
notable_facts: Principal author of the Declaration of Independence; completed the Louisiana Purchase.

name: James Madison
notable_facts: Father of the Constitution; led the nation during the War of 1812.

name: James Monroe
notable_facts: Known for the Monroe Doctrine; presided over the 'Era of Good Feelings.'

name: John Quincy Adams
notable_facts: Son of John Adams; later served in the U.S. House of Representatives.

name: Andrew Jackson
notable_facts: Founder of the Democratic Party; known for controversial Indian Removal policies.

name: Martin Van Buren
previous_position: Vice President of the United States
notable_facts: First president born as a U.S. citizen.

name: William Henry Harrison
notable_facts: Served the shortest presidency, dying just 31 days after inauguration.

name: John Tyler
previous_position: Vice President of the United States
notable_facts: First vice president to become president due to the death of his predecessor.

name: James K. Polk
notable_facts: Oversaw significant territorial expansion of the United States, including the annexation of Texas and the Oregon Territory.

name: Zachary Taylor
previous_position: Major General in the U.S. Army
notable_facts: Died just 16 months into his term; hero of the Mexican-American War.

name: Millard Fillmore
previous_position: Vice President of the United States
notable_facts: Assumed presidency after Taylorâ€™s death; supported the Compromise of 1850.

name: Franklin Pierce
notable_facts: His support for the Kansas-Nebraska Act heightened tensions leading to the Civil War.

name: James Buchanan
previous_position: U.S. Minister to the United Kingdom
notable_facts: Only lifelong bachelor president; his inaction contributed to the secession crisis.

name: Abraham Lincoln
notable_facts: Led the U.S. through the Civil War and issued the Emancipation Proclamation.

name: Andrew Johnson
previous_position: Vice President of the United States
notable_facts: First U.S. president to be impeached; survived removal by one Senate vote.

name: Ulysses S. Grant
notable_facts: Civil War hero; presidency marred by scandals though personally honest.

name: Rutherford B. Hayes
notable_facts: Ended Reconstruction by withdrawing federal troops from the South.

name: James A. Garfield
notable_facts: Assassinated after only a few months in office.

name: Chester A. Arthur
previous_position: Vice President of the United States
notable_facts: Known for civil service reform, signing the Pendleton Civil Service Reform Act.

name: Grover Cleveland
notable_facts: Only president to serve two non-consecutive terms.

name: Benjamin Harrison
notable_facts: Grandson of William Henry Harrison; six states admitted to the Union during his presidency.

name: Grover Cleveland
previous_position: Former President of the United States
notable_facts: Only president to return to office after losing reelection.

name: William McKinley
notable_facts: Led the nation during the Spanish-American War; assassinated in 1901.

name: Theodore Roosevelt
previous_position: Vice President of the United States
notable_facts: Youngest president at age 42; known for trust-busting and conservation efforts.

name: William Howard Taft
notable_facts: Only person to serve as both U.S. President and Chief Justice of the Supreme Court.

name: Woodrow Wilson
notable_facts: Led the nation during World War I and proposed the League of Nations.

name: Warren G. Harding
notable_facts: His administration was marred by scandals, including the Teapot Dome scandal.

name: Calvin Coolidge
previous_position: Vice President of the United States
notable_facts: Nicknamed 'Silent Cal'; known for his quiet demeanor and pro-business policies.

name: Herbert Hoover
notable_facts: Presided during the onset of the Great Depression.

name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
notable_facts: Only president elected to four terms; led the U.S. through the Great Depression and World War II.

name: Harry S. Truman
previous_position: Vice President of the United States
notable_facts: Authorized the use of atomic bombs on Japan; oversaw the Marshall Plan and start of the Cold War.

name: Dwight D. Eisenhower
notable_facts: Promoted interstate highway system; warned of the 'military-industrial complex.'

name: John F. Kennedy
notable_facts: Youngest elected president; assassinated in Dallas, Texas.

name: Lyndon B. Johnson
previous_position: Vice President of the United States
notable_facts: Signed Civil Rights Act of 1964; escalated U.S. involvement in Vietnam War.

name: Richard Nixon
previous_position: Vice President of the United States
notable_facts: Only U.S. president to resign; known for Watergate scandal.

name: Gerald Ford
previous_position: Vice President of the United States
notable_facts: Only president never elected as president or vice president; pardoned Nixon.

name: Jimmy Carter
notable_facts: Brokered the Camp David Accords; later awarded Nobel Peace Prize in 2002.

name: Ronald Reagan
notable_facts: Former actor; credited with ending the Cold War; survived an assassination attempt.

name: George H. W. Bush
previous_position: Vice President of the United States
notable_facts: Led coalition forces during the Gulf War; father of George W. Bush.

name: Bill Clinton
notable_facts: Presided over economic prosperity; impeached but acquitted in the Senate.

name: George W. Bush
notable_facts: President during the 9/11 attacks; launched wars in Afghanistan and Iraq.

name: Barack Obama
notable_facts: First African American president; signed the Affordable Care Act.

name: Donald Trump
notable_facts: Impeached twice; promoted 'America First' policies.

name: Joe Biden
previous_position: Vice President of the United States
notable_facts: Oldest person elected president; focused on COVID-19 response and restoring alliances.
